Enrollment Requirements: Reserved for Freshmen and Sophomores
Add Consent: Department Consent Required
title: WCAS PHIL 109-6-21 First-Year Seminar in Philosophy

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course will address various conceptions of the aims and value of a college education. We will look at arguments from various quarters: humanist, economic, sociological/political, and skeptical. We will consider the question of the value of a college education not only from the perspective of the person in college, but also from the perspective of the broader community.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The purpose will be for each student to be able to recognize the strengths and weaknesses of various conceptions of the aims and value of a college education, to articulate her or his own views in relation to these, and to be able to defend those views against leading objections.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Five short (2-page) papers (10% each x 5 papers = 50% of total grade), one longer (5-page) term paper (40%), class participation (10%).

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: The Aims of Higher Education, ISBN: 9780226259482 Excellent Sheep: The Miseducation of the American Elite, ISBN: 978-1-4767-0272-8 The Oxford Handbook of Philosophy of Education, ISBN: 978-0-19-991572-9 Cultivating Humanity, ISBN 0-674-17949-8 various articles.
